items.text: Some kind of bot which you can feed with your lecture recordings and such. This then will be helpful during studying by answering any questions you have regarding the lectures' other input.
I want to create an application in which you can type in available vegetables and ingredients and receive ideas for recipes that are possible.
A letter randomizer to help make letters unreadable or create strong passwords.

Synonym Finder: It can be hard writing long essays and texts without constantly repeating yourself and using the same simple words. The synonym finder will make it possible to find new words with the same or similar meaning. Simply put the word you would usually use into the search bar and the generator will try its best.

Ein Tracker, welcher mir hilft, über all meine Bewerbungen einen Überblick zu behalten. Im Moment muss ich viele Bewerbungen für Jobs, Unis, Praktika etc. schreiben und da verliert man schnell mal den Überblick. Das Tool verwaltet alle Kontakte, Bewerbungsunterlagen, Infos zu Prozessen etc. und erinnert rechtzeitig an Follow-Ups, Bewerbungsgespräche.

I would like to create a tracker that correlates health (physical and mental) with study outcomes. The idea is that we input certain health metrics (minutes and type of exercise, meditation, stress levels, etc.). We also input various grades throughout the school year, as well as a daily difficulty/ease in learning score. The app should be able to tell us which of the health metrics are having the biggest effects (positive or negative) on our study outcomes.

Learning a language is always difficult and demanding. You need a lot of input, and you get it mostly from teachers and/or whatever app you are using. This input is, however, always limited to the structure of your course and to predetermined learning goals. If you want to learn a language in such a way that you can communicate with others in a more casual way, you need to have real-life contact with native speakers your age. My idea, therefore, would be to create an app that can be used parallel to your normal language courses and that can reliably find out how certain expressions are said in your target language, so that you can develop the casual part of learning a language from the beginning.

The project: CV adapter. The program will rewrite your application CV using a template, so that it is perfectly tailored to the place you're applying to. By using keywords and job-specific descriptions, it will raise your chances to get a job as well as lower the time and energy needed for each application.
A program that helps explain legal language for immigrants with limited understanding of the German language.

Project will provide an opportunity to analyze news on certain topics defined by the user from various media sources of the selected countries (the UK, the US, Germany, France, Russia, Poland, and Ukraine, for instance) in English. The media to be used are the ones with the most quotations in the selected states. After having been introduced to the topic by the user, the program would give the list of the latest publications on the presented issue so as to give access to read these news to the user on his/her own. Afterwards, the project is expected to deliver the output in the form of a summary of all the provided sources to the user, explaining the viewpoints argued in each publication. The last derivative would be the aggregate position on the topic from the media of the selected countries. Such a project would certainly facilitate searching and analysis of recent news by journalists, analysts, policymakers, etc.

I want to create a program that helps users practice touch typing. I feel like this skill is surprisingly undertaught to Gen-Z and especially Gen Alpha cohorts in school, as we expect members of these generations to be technologically literate merely through exposure to the Internet. At some level, I believe this would require gamification in order to capture these demographics' shorter attention span. In order to differentiate this program from the numerous available courses online for the same.

I would like to create a coding project where users can state their mood, feelings or emotions and get suggestions for entertainment according to that mood. For example, if somebody is feeling a little down and wants to wallow in those feelings, the code will reply with adequate music, movies or other forms of media. Or, if a person is feeling sad and wants to brighten their mood, the code will reply with upbeat and feel-good suggestions. The forms of media can include music, movies, quotes, literature, etc. If the user is unhappy with the choices given, they’re able to ask for more suggestions. If the user is not “feeling

I want to create a game, either a kind of king of the hill, where you have a character and you climb a hill and with the arrow movement you try to avoid the obstacles on the way, or a geometric game where you get to see a geometric shape for an amount of time and the further you get, the harder and more difficult they become. And you see the geometric shape each time a bit shorter. Up to level 50, let’s say. And you have to either draw or describe it in a set amount of time that’s also set.

I'm thinking about a home decor program. One can put in different colours, aesthetics (modern, Victorian), budget, the room it is intended for (bedroom, kitchen), and based on that the program will generate pictures that fit and the link to buy the items in the picture.

I plan to create an algorithm that checks (my) mixes for clashing frequencies, dynamics/perceived loudness and overall “muddiness”. I want to create a better workflow for artists without the capacities or the capital to mix properly. The program should not mix itself - it should only tell you how you could “improve” them so the final decision is still in the hands of the actual creator. Emotion and the vision itself are not blurred by technology and equations.

Even though I do not have any concrete ideas right now, I plan to focus on the areas I am interested in contributing to. It could be something related to music, politics, and cultural exchange. I could do work on a project which could be used in intercultural events and environments.

Based on the already existing idea of Nightshade, have a small script which automatically adds noise to an uploaded image, which makes it unable to be processed by data scrapers for AI learning. I am not sure how feasible this idea is, since my experience with coding is pretty limited and more research into the methods of Nightshade and other similar projects is definitely required.

My project seeks to allow individuals to become more resourceful and environmentally conscious by developing a program where the user can maneuver through a portal and find a variety of uses for things often considered useless, but can often have a negative environmental impact. Ex. Rubber bands being used as a chopstick learning tool.

As someone who has struggled to learn German for the past few years, an idea I have in mind is a code with a database of articles for the German nouns. Basically, the first version would provide the der/die/das articles in Nominativ after you put a noun into the template. Potentially, that could be done with either a database of words or a specific combination of letters that usually are associated with a specific article. Moreover, over time the system could be developed to also show the article in Akkusativ, Dativ and Genitiv, depending on what you choose on an extra toggle. Such a program would definitely help non-natives quickly search up the grammatically correct version of the article, without skimming through dictionaries.

Creating a DBMS based library management system. It would essentially read in and extract data from an SQL based database, change variables and have different user levels (guest, students, librarian and so on). Interactive UI made, the whole in two different apps, one for the database (like SQLite) and one for the code and the transmission of messages as SQL and the code, like VSCode, or Alpha Studio Code. Furthermore, it would include return date reminder, money managing and much more features. Another idea (I have to use this as well, I like it so much) is a real life distance calculator. It would combine maths with empirical input. It would include 3 lasers, one straight and two tilted slightly further placed to form two right angled triangles when the lasers intersect. The empirical part is you have to see where the lasers intersect. The closer an object comes to the pointer the more tilted the two additional lasers become and the further away, the more straight they become. A simple calculation of angles (tan) in real time to determine a distance. No sensors just one that sees the tilt and the program calculates the distance.

To create a project that links you to beauticians, cosmetic surgeons and doctors around the globe who are licensed and can make the best lip fillers and cosmetic surgeries. This will ensure people will not go to dodgy doctors in Turkey or Colombia and boost health and beauty tourism. This will also help people who live in countries where healthcare is expensive like the USA. Doctors will be ranked and rated by experts and clients. We cannot stop people from...

My project idea is to create a Python program that tracks everyday expenses. Users can enter the amount they spend and the category (e.x. food, transport, leisure etc). The program will save all entries in a CSV file and summarize total spending per category. It will also calculate the total monthly spending automatically. I will use pandas for data organization and simple statistics. The goal is to help users better understand their spending habits. It automates a useful part of personal finance management in everyday life.

One project idea could be creating a chat service for people under threat, could be abuse, domestic violence, queer closeted kid, or anyone suffering from a social issue. This hotline is supposed to be fully anonymous and encrypted where tracking it is hard for outside agents. People who are suffering and would like a quick consultation either on phone or chat - can fill a small form about some details, and then an AI algorithm can forward them to a specialized agent who can help them either deal with the issue or get help without putting themselves in danger. These agents could be volunteers, but also paid by donors who want to support the cause. In addition, there can be a system where a database collects specific data of endangered people without revealing their identity - for the purpose of giving this data to researchers and therefore generate some money as an incentive for the specialized agents to work.

The project is about helping chemistry students access and memorize chemical formulae. It is based on Cambridge O Level and A Level syllabus. So the student obviously needs to enter the syllabus code as different syllabuses have different syllabus codes. Afterwards, the student needs to enter the compound name for which the formulae is to be displayed. E.g. ketone, then a list of ketone-related chemical equations and formulae will be shown. After that, if the student wants to memorize the formulae, then he must enter the word 'test', so as multiple choice questions will be displayed and therefore after each answer, correction will also be displayed.

My project is called “Language Learning Assistant.” It is a simple Python program that helps users study and memorize foreign words. The user can enter new words together with their translations, and the program saves them for later use. After that, the program offers a short quiz to test how well the user remembers the vocabulary. It checks each answer and shows the correct translation if the user makes a mistake. The program also keeps track of progress and shows how many words were learned correctly. This small project helped me understand the basics of Python, such as loops, conditions, and working with user input. I also used ChatGPT to get help with writing the code, generating word examples, and improving the quiz logic.

I want to develop an algorithm that requires users to write a reflective sentence each morning/evening, so it can identify if the user is doing mentally (spiritually and emotionally) better than the initial use date. A lot of times we (humans/people) aren't quick enough to identify if we are reaching the borderline of a breakdown or burnout, so this algorithm will serve as an external warning to us to take care of ourselves and generally as another form of 'mirror' so we can find how we are doing in a world where time is a scarcity, for us to even reflect or meditate. A lot of times, we would have hoped for a warning before we consider it as too late, and I want this tool to serve as a helping reflective hand in our daily lives.

I am planning to create a mechanism with which knitters or crocheters can find new projects. Most knitters/crochet artists will know the problem of having only a little amount of a specific yarn left and not knowing what to do with it. Throwing it away would obviously be a waste, so I want to create a solution. In my project, you should be able to write what yarn (colour and amount) and needles you have and what general kind of project you would like to take on (maybe depending on season and definitely depending on whether one knits or crochets). With that information, the AI will give you a project that uses your leftover yarn and brings you a lot of joy!

My project focuses on creating an application that helps passengers claim compensation for flight issues such as delays, cancellations, or overbooking. The app will guide users through their legal rights under EU and international aviation laws. It will also provide automatic eligibility checks to see if they qualify for financial compensation. In addition to delayed or canceled flights, it will cover problems like lost, damaged, or delayed baggage. Users will be able to upload their flight details, and the app will calculate the exact amount they can claim. It will also offer templates for complaint letters and direct submission to airlines. The goal is to make the compensation process fast, transparent, and stress-free. Overall, this project aims to empower travelers to fully understand and use their passenger rights.

I plan to do a project about an expense tracker. Simply, you log your daily expenses and the program will calculate the total amount you've spent over a selected period such as days, weeks, or months. The purpose of this project is to help individuals make their spending habits better and give them an understanding of their spending habits. I also believe it would be great to add sections to the tracker such as expenses of food, transportation, and entertainment or so many more.

The aim of the project is to analyze individuals’ tendencies to make sustainable economic decisions and examine the micro-level economic impacts of these choices. The target group consists of university students, as young individuals shape the future behaviors of consumers and investors. An online survey will be conducted to assess participants’ saving, investment, and consumption habits. Survey results will reveal the relationships between financial awareness, income level, and sustainability consciousness. Based on these findings, a “Financial Awareness Workshop” will be designed to improve economic decision-making behaviors. The workshop will be supported by behavioral economics principles and allow observation of participants’ decision-making processes. Following the pilot implementation, changes in participants’ financial attitudes will be measured through surveys and brief interviews. The project outcomes will be presented as a model for institutions aiming to develop sustainable individual economic policies.

My idea is about electric cars and their services, so I would like to do a space which will unite the charger locations, booking the charger, also if someone has their own charger they can add on this website. Moreover, I could ask some companies who have the services of the electric cars and create a hub for it, that will include the above-mentioned features plus services. I think this idea is practical, useful for people that if you are on your way, you can look for available chargers or book them in advance. Moreover, for people, it would be a chance to have a stable income, as far as they will buy these chargers and rent them.

I have planned a project on how we can use AI in supermarkets. As a big digital screen which can tell us what we can cook and make at home by scanning the item that we want to buy, and it will also include the date when the expiration date ends. With those screens, we can prevent food waste and eat clean at home, which is a lot healthier than eating outside.

My project idea is to create an intelligent program that helps users build a healthy and sustainable lifestyle through mindful technology. The program offers personalized fitness tips, balanced meal suggestions, and plant-based nutrition guidance that align with both physical well-being and environmental care. It analyzes a user’s daily habits and provides eco-friendly alternatives — from ethical food choices to sustainable product swaps. Unlike ordinary health apps, it emphasizes mindfulness and encourages users to understand the deeper connection between personal health and planetary health. The goal is to make sustainability simple, actionable, and emotionally engaging. The program also tracks the user’s progress toward a 'green wellness score,' motivating consistent, conscious behavior. By integrating wellness, ethics, and technology, this idea empowers individuals to live healthier lives while reducing their ecological footprint. It’s not just about being fit — it’s about being responsibly well.

Creating a document recommendator, based on mood, genre, possibly even the producer, the idea is basically for the program to be able to recommend you from a list of docs, specifically relating to your mood or area of which you want to watch. In my mind, this would allow you to not only find movies you might have never thought of watching but also to possibly educate yourself on topics you did not think of searching for yourself.

It's the future app where you can immediately choose where you will go. How will it happen? In a random way. You just need to choose how much time you would like to spend to get to the destination, your preferences (cafes, parks, museums, etc.) and of course your city. And just go to this place on every vehicle as you want. It's your choice how you would like to spend your free time. Of course, for a person who never did such a task before it will be hard to create such a project, but maybe I will understand how I can do it.

My idea is a program that could offer an alternative or a more sustainable version of something. For example, if you type in an object that you would like to buy, this program would show the most sustainable version of it or would offer you an alternative which is more sustainable. It would search it on the Internet and would make it easier for everyone with little effort to find the best both for them and our planet. That could help people to be more conscious when it comes to buying something new.

This is a game which you can learn basic words, for example "Hello", "Thank you" and "Goodbye", in various languages. It displays a name of a country with the national flag, and you need to type the basic words of the language mainly spoken in the country. It helps you to learn basic words of many languages, live in a diverse, international environment more comfortably with curiosity, and understand and respect people from different places with different cultural backgrounds more through languages.

The program recommends you a book/e-book/audio-book that is already in your possession based on genre, mood, tags. I would also add if I have already read the book or not, how long it would take me to read it. Just a bunch of filters to skip the phase where you decide a new book to read.

More and more people are turning towards a vegan lifestyle to take responsibility for their own GHG emissions, decrease world suffering, or to eat more plants. It can be a struggle to switch to a vegan diet, so I want to help facilitate this shift, specifically in the kitchen, by coding a program that swiftly suggests swaps and alternatives for non-vegan recipes. This would take into account if the recipe is sweet or salty and potentially how it is processed. For example, if it is a raw dessert or one-pot meal, the substitution of butter may differ. In the earlier example, it would be coconut oil or margarine, but in the latter, oil would be more suitable. So you would put in your recipe, the program detects if it is salty or sweet and what animal products are included in the recipe and need to be substituted with plant-based alternatives and reveals to you the most suitable substitute to continue having fun in the kitchen without harming animals or the planet!

My project could be coding a flashcard set. You would have to write the word yourself as well as the translation in the language you want. You can also add articles, grammar, or any other information about the word on the flashcard. The system would automatically give you the words you would have to go through that day and the time between going through the same cards would increase. The system would also show you if you wrote the word wrong and set it on the next day's pile of words to go through again.

We sometimes struggle with choosing outfits for the day. The application will have an outfit generator function, where clothing items will be stored into different categories, such as: tops, bottoms, shoes, accessories, etc. (depending on the user’s preferences). The app will be able to generate outfits, making sure that they won’t repeat as much as possible. The additional features will include: analyzing the weather conditions for the day, creating favorite outfits, putting certain clothes on hold if they are in the laundry, and user feedback to maximize their satisfaction. The app could also plan out outfits for the upcoming week to help the user plan ahead.

My planned project is a very simple to-do list application. It will be designed to help users keep track of their tasks. The program will allow users to add new tasks, tick/mark/cross them off when they're completed, delete tasks as well as add new ones. I will make this program using Python. I hope to gain and improve my coding skills and learn how to make a program that is useful in everyday life. Hopefully, I will gain enough skill to be adding features like due dates or a simple menu.

Because I’m an international student and I don’t know German yet, my coding project will revolve around improving my German vocabulary. My project will allow you to enter the words you are working on with the respective meanings in English and quiz you on them. A German or English word will appear and you must type the correct solution in to move on to the next. I think it would be fun to make a game out of it, so there will be an optional timer to see how fast you can complete your entire list. It would also be good to put an adjustable countdown for each word.

Create an app that is directly linked to our phone's wallet (Apple/Google) that tracks your spending and logs your into the right category every time you use your card on your phone. It would send you notifications when you are close to a certain amount you have decided to spend by month and can be synced to your bank account or shared with other people. It would help us be more organized and more aware of your spending, but also help in need of budgeting. For parents, it would be a good way to

An extensive medical database can aid in diagnosis by utilizing AI to store large amounts of data and quickly assess a list of symptoms to predict the most likely diagnoses. It can also consider users' medical histories—such as preexisting conditions and current medications—stored during registration, allowing for a comprehensive evaluation of various factors. While the AI-assisted diagnosis would need oversight from a medical professional, it could serve as a valuable tool to shorten the triage phase of care, potentially reducing wait times, especially in light of the healthcare professional shortage. Additionally, self-administering this information on an online platform may help patients feel safer, as their sensitive information remains private and does not have to be disclosed verbally, thus expediting the process.

I would like to create a simplified version of an app or a platform that helps users manage their finances by analyzing spending patterns and suggesting budgeting tips. I don't know if it's too complicated, but I would like to incorporate visualizations to help users understand their financial habits.

For “Uni Quests”, users could create to-do lists for their readings or assignments, but each task completion could earn them points or experience to level up fictional characters or avatars. There are also challenges or quests related to studying, where completing a set of tasks within a certain timeframe grants bonus rewards. Integration with a calendar could show deadlines and upcoming tasks while allowing users to schedule study sessions as 'quest times.' Additionally, a social feature could let students form study groups, complete challenges together, and share achievements, making the entire process more engaging and collaborative.

The program collects uploaded files (can be unloaded 1 file per every new use of the program). Then it stores files and analyzes them, and gives a short review (the user may choose to click yes or no in). Analyze is created using AI.

I would like to program a learning game which can be used in schools. I was thinking about a visually appealing and rewarding quiz for students in middle school. If possible for a beginner, maybe even a small 2D adventure game with different rooms and challenges. Combining fun and educational content to give students a valuable learning experience. Topics could be about the respective subject the quiz is used in or general knowledge needed for introducing students to a certain field of academics.

An automatic file sorter, so that anything you download will be automatically saved in a folder, by creating a new one or by saving it in an already existing folder. It can also sort other files that are already downloaded on your PC, and you can specify the files or folders you want to be sorted.

I want to create an application that keeps you responsible for your own actions. As a university student, it is easy to get too little sleep or get too drunk or just be plain overwhelmed with the challenges of living alone. My application should allow you to rest easy, knowing that you can rely on it to remind you that you have already been to three parties this week and it is only Wednesday or that you have postponed doing assignments four times this week. It should effectively be nothing more than a note-taking application with reminder functionality. In this way, it could have therapeutic benefits as well, because putting your obligations and responsibilities to the digital paper means you have to confront them and can quantify them, making them seem less scary. The app can also train you for post-university adulthood, since using it will train you to track expenses and monitor your own health.

I want to try creating a project that will suggest modulation paths from one musical key to another. When done elegantly, a key change is a powerful tool in songwriting – but simply jumping from one key to another can sound harsh if music theory principles are left out of consideration. My project will aim to suggest key transitions that sound effortless and interesting. The user will need to input a start and target key (or chord, not sure about that yet) and the algorithm will analyze how many steps need to be taken to get from the original to the target key. In a final step, the proposed transition will be displayed to the user, maybe even with alternative suggestions.

If possible as a beginner project, I want to create a general ranking system for everyday use. This idea popped up when I made a list of my 100 favorite songs in order, but I was never satisfied with the position of songs, so I kept moving the songs around. I want to create a ranking system where you input a list of things/songs/ideas you want to rank, and then the program inputs those into a bracket system, where you use the left/right arrow keys or click on one of the two cards on screen (each displaying the text of what you want to rank), which the program inputs into the system and remembers, ultimately giving you the best output/winning song. But after the best song is chosen, the program uses its memory of which songs beat which to ask you more of these 'A or B' questions to make you rate each song against the others that are left to give you a list ranking all 100 songs against each other. I'm explaining it badly, but basically if song A beat song B, and song B beat song A, the program wouldn't ask if you like song A more than song C, as it already knows that from previous answers. I haven't seen anything like this anywhere, where you put in a list of whatever you like and then rank them, and I think it would be useful not just for fun (ranking your favorite songs), but also for ranking ideas and projects. Instead of 'which is my favorite' you could ask:

An app that helps you truly understand what your hair responds to. It lets you log every product you use — from shampoos and masks to oils and leave-ins — and note how your hair felt afterward. Over time, the app learns your hair type, texture, and needs, using that data to show which products actually make a difference. You can add photos after each wash or treatment to visually track progress. It then analyzes your entries, spotting patterns and highlighting which routines gave you the best results. Ingredient insights help you understand what’s nourishing or damaging your hair. The app also reminds you when it’s time to wash, trim, or apply a mask. Gradually, it becomes a personal hair-care companion that knows exactly what “hits” for your hair.

A smart grocery list: At the start of the week you would put in everything you normally like to have in your fridge/pantry etc. and throughout the week when you use something up, you check the box and it automatically appears on your grocery list for next Monday. The stuff you have not bought but still usually like to have will also appear on the list. Perhaps to take it even further you could simply scan your receipt and the data would transfer directly into the project, so that new things that show up more than once would also be added to the grocery list. You would not have to make time or come up with ideas on what to add to your list, because the list would already be done for you and so you would be able to save some time.

I want to create a MBTI game that is fun and engaging for both the ones familiar with it and those that aren’t. I want it to be a game you can play with up to four people who either guess each other's MBTI or create dialogues set to be responses by the MBTI types. Maybe also “Guess the celebrities MBTI” or “Who’s the MBTI in question” could be a fun way to play it. I also want it to be educational and useful for potential users in terms of using it to get to know strangers as well as maybe in the work market.

Creating a unique approach to to-do tracking that categorizes tasks on a graphic 2-axis system. Making it easier for the user to decide on what task to start based on their positioning of what is important to them. The user can change parameters of the importance to change the results. It should be simple and non-distracting. It should give a clear look at the user’s priorities.

A program that can scan grocery store receipts to read what products have been bought, in order to remind the user of their expiry dates to reduce food waste. An image would be uploaded, and the program, thanks to Optical Character Recognition, would be able to "read" the products and create a list. Then, it would estimate the shelf life of these products, for example: fresh tomatoes -> 5 days left. This data would be then sorted into a table for easier accessibility for the user, with products expiring sooner at the top of the table. The algorithm would update the remaining days for each product every day, and the user would be able to tick used products away. This would be useful to reduce food waste, as well as mental strain on individuals.

I can't come up with a feasible "project idea" on command, especially with no provided details that would guide me. Ideas come from spontaneous thoughts, noticing patterns, studying something, having problems. It's not something that can be just generated. I refuse to use AI for this or anything since it has no capacity for originality. I feel like the approach of "brainstorm something and ask chatgpt" shows a gross misunderstanding of this matter.

I want to create a coding project that helps users to identify nearby community resources based on their location. It will work by firstly asking users for their city or zip code. Then the program will utilize an API like Google Places or a public service database to query resources. You can use the `requests` library to handle API requests.
- **Display Results**: Format and display the fetched data in a user-friendly manner, showing addresses and resource descriptions.

Every night when going to the bathroom and turning on the light, I get flashbanged because it is so bright. What would be needed to improve my quality of life on the daily is a way to adjust this light based on either the time of day or the ambient light level. To solve, my idea is to use a dimmable smart light using a microcontroller running Micropython. With switch control, you can switch between ambient and time-based modes. The light brightness and color tone are adjusted automatically according to a pre-defined pattern and the selected mode. A motion sensor can also be implemented to replace the physical light switch. To top off the design cleanly, a 3D printed housing will be created to keep the package clean and safe.

Online Security isn’t promised, noticing peculiar activities has become the norm. I want to develop a unique but very safe multifactor authentication. I want to feel safe whilst searching online or using social media. After developing the program, I’m going to test it rigorously for security vulnerabilities. Hopefully, I ensure that my project offers a user-friendly experience.

A program that helps us students stay active even during busy days. At the start, you describe your goals and intensity of the activities. The program will send you daily reminders with sport ideas and can even log your activities. The sport reminders will adapt to your uni calendar. I would like to also include motivational quotes to keep the motivation going.

A program that calculates how much water is used during everyday life. For example, a person can tell it that they've showered for 15 minutes or that they have cleaned the dishes for an hour. The 3 variables for the program would be 'activity', 'time', and 'water pressure' (which would simply be light, medium, or hard). The program would then be able to approximately tell how much water is used up in liters. This could put into perspective how much water is actually used in everyday life. The person can then change their behavior accordingly. To every activity, the program would also give tips and advice on how to minimize water wastage.

Personal carbon footprint tracker. It will help you to make your life more eco-friendly. You can track your daily activities, your energy emissions and the food you eat and calculate your personal footprint. Furthermore, you can set goals and it can help you to improve your lifestyle by giving you tips and advice. Another important aspect would be sharing your experiences with others so that you can build a strong community to help each other to achieve their goals and stay connected.

I plan to create a Study Helper who, upon prompting, will give out motivational phrases, tips to study, meditation exercises and more. Should the person using the application want a more hands-on breaktime activity, the program will be able to supply short yoga exercises to do in an office environment (especially helpful for students in libraries or communal areas). If I have the time, I would like to implement a schedule helper as well, which, when given information about tasks to do and their length, will create a schedule with breaks and breaktime exercises and breathing practices. I would like the interface to be clean and minimalistic, probably with some calming green or blue details. If I have a lot of extra time, I will include little rewards that can be achieved once a task is completed or a mini-workout is done. With the rewards, you would be able to buy accessories for a desktop/application pet, which you can dress up and make comfortable through the rewards. Also, I might put in some video and audio material.

My idea is to build a Tinder-like platform for musicians. Many musicians, such as clarinet players like me, often need an accompaniment instrument like piano or cello. The problem is that it’s not always easy to find other musicians nearby. This app would create a space where musicians can connect with each other. If you are practicing a piece and need an accompaniment, you can search or swipe through different instruments or players. The platform would show you potential matches based on your instrument, location, and preferences. You could then chat, share sheet music, and arrange rehearsals together. In short, it’s a social network that helps musicians find the perfect partner to play with.

Task Management App, that helps you manage your tasks and keeps you up to date with deadlines. It also alerts you before every deadline and if successfully met, it recommends a movie, a podcast or a fun activity to do afterwards… as a reward.

I would like to either program a concert tracker that you can maybe attach to your Spotify account, to show concert recommendations based on listening habits and followed artists. I want it to be built like a calendar that shows the concerts on their respective dates. After clicking on the concert day, it should open into a menu that shows links to different ticket sellers and general information about the event.

I like doing Pilates workouts on YouTube, but I always have to filter through so many different workouts. Therefore, I thought about creating a program/website where I can select what body group I would like to focus on and which equipment(s) I would like to use. Then the program selects the workouts that meet my criteria and I don’t have to sort through so many manually anymore. Which means more time to workout :)

A new application for helping people who move into a new country. It may contain general information about the country/city and ways to enter a community. Furthermore, there will be help for learning the language and for finding accommodations. A tutor will be available to show the city and help with all necessary.

I would like to create a program which can help people who are passionate about nature to recognize plants and fungi by providing a description of them on the chat of the program itself. I want it to be simple to use and as descriptive as possible. Ideally, I would add image recognition as well, but it could be too complicated to create.

My project would aim to help small talk and conversations with friends go a lot smoother and easier by assisting with language barriers in a fun and engaging way. If one is spacing on a word and can’t seem to remember what it means in the other language, they can simply type it into the app/program and it will visualize this word by making a drawing/a cartoon, etc. Adding to that, people could also draw something themselves. By showing this to the other person, they can easily figure out what the first person meant. The program would ease conversations with language barriers in a fun way while also helping people learn a different language more.

I would like to create a tool or simple app to help people stop smoking. It will include motivational quotes, deadlines, reminders, and milestones. There will be rewards for the milestones which the user can create/set. Daily smoking goals can be input and if they are not reached, the daily amount will be adjusted. It would include a colorful user interface, with a cute mascot. The current goals and motivational quotes will be shown in a chat bubble over the mascot.
Based on how you’re feeling, it recommends you an activity (music, sport, reading, walking, talking to someone…)

I would like to create a personal AI assistant for everyone that filters your WhatsApp, News, and LinkedIn messages or notifications. It’s like if Jarvis would give you a daily briefing about the to-do list, news, and weather that interacts with you personally. It uses your data you preselected and notifications you allowed to pop up on screen and filters the information that is the most important for you. You choose what you need and train this AI like a child to a grown-up. I would describe it like an Alfred for Bruce Wayne with the exception that you cannot let it do your work; instead, it will encourage you by using your to-do list or anything else you like (e.g. citations from stoic philosophers).

I will create a tool that will advise me when I need to water my indoor plants. It will be based on each plant's individual needs and the local environment of the plant, e.g. indoor, average temp, seasons. Ideally, it should be able to be exported into a calendar for reminders on the day which plant should be watered.

My idea is a bus arrival time probability indicator. As buses in Lüneburg are currently not tracked, and arrival schedules for buses seem to be inaccurate, I’d like to code something that shows the probability that one’s bus will be on time based on patterns including time of day, bus driver (anonymous), and other people’s current feedback for the same bus line. The first two conditions would analyze past patterns, exclude outliers, and learn for accuracy. The 3rd condition would include participation from the users and ask them at what time their bus left the stop, so that people waiting on the same bus route can have more accurate information. The program would use the scheduled time versus the information from the other 3 conditions to calculate probability for a minute-by-minute basis for the time in which the bus is most likely to come as it deviates from the expected time.

A shared calendar with friends that allows you to make the most out of your week, as you can for example make it compatible with your smartwatch and also connect it with your friends. The idea is that everyone notes their to-dos and the due dates for different tasks in their individual calendar and when events collide with others you have connected your calendar with, the AI system will notify you so that you have the possibility to complete the task together. It can also be connected with the weather app and will suggest what day would be best for outdoor activities such as jogging, which you could then also do with a friend. If the system notices that two or more people have an exam soon, it can also suggest study sessions in a time slot where both individuals haven’t planned anything in their calendar yet. It is ideal for a busy friend group as the calendar could notify everyone when they all have a free time slot and also suggest what to do depending on events and weather or future exams during that time.

I am planning on creating a dictionary which focuses on terms used in gaming communities, including definitions, usage examples and the origins of slang. Furthermore, I plan to implement LLMs into the project in a way that they automate data gathering, highlighting their ability to scrape content from forums, summarize information, analyze text to identify trends, and facilitate user suggestions for.

I want to do a budget app where I can help users track their income and expenses in a simple way. The user will enter their financial transactions and the app will make a report showing their month-to-date or year-to-date summary. I can also add a "goal" or budget challenge feature.

My planned project would be a Theatre plan analyzer, which would look at the most recent data on Lüneburg Theatre website and transcribe that accordingly into an overlay of my choosing using Python. The data would be packaged to be easily accessible and readable. The premise of the program is that it would automatically via Windows notification notify the user 2 hours before a show starts as well as checking if there are available tickets. By doing that, theatre lovers like myself would not miss out on any shows, due to the culture ticket all students are allowed to attend a play free, provided there are tickets 30 minutes before the show starts, still available.

I want ideas for my project. I would like to introduce the topic of digital media and storytelling for my coding project from an ethical perspective in terms of how we are developing ourselves for my coding project. Right now beim Finken gebaut, creating something cold mirror AI which will analyze everything I tell him and fact check it and contradict me with real knowledge based on research papers and so on.

Since I study cultural studies, I am thinking of making a game which can help people learn more about different cultures. 1. A cultural word association game. Players could be given a word related to a specific culture—like 'Samba' for Brazil or 'Kimono' for Japan—and need to type out related words or phrases within a time limit. You can use basic loops and conditionals to check their responses and keep score. This game would help players learn about cultural vocabulary and significance. As an enhancement, consider adding brief explanations for each word after the game ends, enriching the educational experience while keeping it fun and interactive.

Maybe it would be nice to assign kind of photos to each of the buildings. Let's say I have the session at Building 12, so this will provide me photos of the building and Google Maps link to the place (there is a way to share the location from Google Maps). It could simplify our life a bit in terms of being on time during week 1 & 2. Basically, as an input you write, let's say, Building 12, and as an output it will give you the photo of Building 12 and Google Maps pathway to this place from your location.

A habit tracker that monitors daily habits and progress and can help achieve goals. For example, a person wants to get into the habit of running. The tracker can be used to see how often per month a person does the activity and sends motivational messages at certain times to encourage and help progress. When not much progress is seen, it can give suggestions on how to be more motivated to pursue certain habits.

My project is a scenario-based learning tool with an interactive legal glossary, designed to help users explore legal concepts through real-life situations. Users can submit scenarios, such as questions about tenant rights, and the app analyzes keywords to provide tailored guidance while linking relevant legal terms automatically. The tool uses branching scenarios, where each choice leads to different outcomes, helping users understand the consequences of various legal actions. Legal terms are interactive—clicking on them displays definitions, examples, and context, reinforcing vocabulary and comprehension. Users receive instant feedback and scores based on the accuracy of their decisions, highlighting the relationship between their choices and the legal principles involved. The interface is chat-like and user-friendly, featuring color-coded categories, icons, and animations to make scenarios visually engaging and easy to follow. Additionally, the app includes a resource library where users can explore relevant articles, forms, and case studies for a deeper understanding. By combining interactive storytelling with a dynamic glossary, this tool is both novel, as it merges gaming elements with legal education in a unique way, and useful, as it provides practical guidance and reinforces legal literacy.

A programme that begins to record events related to a specific word or phrase. It then filters for keywords that are frequently used or that are related to the general topic of the conversation/text. These words are used to form a conclusion, which can then be used to understand what has happened and possibly gain a different perspective on what was observed at the time. This can be helpful in lectures, meetings and other everyday encounters, as it provides the owner/user with direct feedback.
I would like to program a tool in which talking is translated into different languages and back automatically. Especially when it comes to phone calls and meetings.

A habit and goal tracker that lets you track everyday routines as well as long-term goals. An example for a long-term goal would be to save 500€. The tracker measures your progress and illustrates how far you’ve come. It also shows how often you have done your daily habits that you want to track (for example, exercise). The tracker also lets you connect certain tasks you have to do in order to reach your goals.

Adaptive Morning Routine App, an app that suggests for you the most effective morning routine to start your day the best. Depending on how good you slept, how long, the weather, what you are up to for the day etc. Also depending on your cycle if you’re a woman. Or if you have pets or kids.

My idea would be an app for inclusive language. For an example, already sensible people could use it to improve their wording and learn more, but it’s mostly for an example older people who never really got in touch with marginalized groups and want to learn how to avoid certain words or use the right pronouns for non-binary people. The app allows you to search in different categories, for an example queerness, and could find more knowledge there. But they could also type in certain words that they know are insensitive and get a more appropriate word for it.

I am thinking about something that could be used as some sort of dictionary. E.g. a dictionary that would convert slang into regular English. This would help adapt to cultural and social environments faster as someone who isn't native to their current surroundings. Or maybe a dictionary that can convert abbreviations used in text messages to their original meanings. As I have also experienced trouble with abbreviations used by younger people than me.
It is going to be a visual weather app that will also help you to decide what you will wear. E.g. 9°C - Take a jacket out with you.

If youre new to kpop , one thing alot of people struggle with is,memorizing which member is which, due to them changing their hairstyle every Comeback, so i would create an code that helps you determine who you are searching for or who you are Looking at, with just a few baseline destriptions.

It’s a project where you can create a mood journal. Therefore, AI asks you how you feel daily and provides, based on your recent answers, methods that may help you feel better and supports you with your individual problems. Moreover, the data gets collected and will provide an analysis of your recent feelings and behavior. This helps you to reflect on your daily life and how to evade those events to live a happier life. Especially if you don’t want to talk about your problems with family or friends, this project provides a perfect anonymous way to talk to.

I'm still not exactly sure, however my current idea includes an app that reminds people who are bound to take their medicine when and how to take it. I have observed my grandmother often forgetting to take hers, so I want to create a program in which you can type in the type of medicine you want and it will kind of create a calendar of when you have to take which medicine. Then, whilst the person is looking on their phone or going about their day, a message pops up, including the name and amount of the medicine, and makes a sound so it won’t go unnoticed.

Management of something, still uncertain what it will be, but maybe something towards finance, because I applied for a job at the AStA, which showed that it is still not automated. This should help a more transparent programme which can be seen by anyone.
The application I want to program should suggest the clothes for the day based on the weather/temperature.

I want to create an application that makes suggestions for what to do in your free time. It will have a set of preset activities that you can select from that you want in your pool of possible activities. I want you to also be able to add your own activities to the pool. It will then select a random activity from that pool, making your decision for you.

I would like to code something that copes with personal emotions: enhance them or change them. For example, a movie generator based on mood. If you feel sad and want to cry, just type in how you feel and films from different categories that fit that particular emotion will generate. There can be 2 categories (if possible) - enhance the emotion or change the emotion. For sadness, the generator will suggest dramas to enhance it; for change, it will suggest comedies. This can work with every emotion and even better - the movie night will be secured. No more time browsing around and wondering what you should watch. Just type in and enjoy/cry/laugh/think….

I’m planning to program a study assistant for university students. In the beginning, you’ll answer a few short questions which determine your learning type and suggest a matching study technique. Then you can choose how long you want to study for and the application will preset timers for you to manage breaks and study time. During breaks, you’ll also get advice on how to recharge, e.g. go for a short walk or have a drink, depending on the length of the break. Depending on feasibility, I could add extra features like a manual on how to do flashcards, etc.

Since a lot of students struggle with learning German, I came up with the following things students find difficult: learning/knowing der/die/das, figuring out whether a certain word is in Akkusativ/Dativ/Genitiv/Nominativ. Therefore, I would like to program an AI 'helper' on top of basic grammar correction. This could be used alongside Grammarly and other apps. It would not only underline words spelled poorly; it would, most importantly, give a brief explanation for why there is a mistake. For example: Ich sehe der Hund. --der underlined with option for switching to den, in brackets parentheses written 'Der+akkusativ=den'. This way, new German students know why there is a mistake in the word they made and they do not just blindly correct based on the internet.
Personal fitness assistant

My idea seeks to gather data on student eating habits in relation to university life. It aims to quantify how many students utilize the cafeteria for meals compared to those who choose to eat at home or purchase food from grocery stores. By narrowing it down to specific time frames like semesters, the research can provide insights into patterns of behavior throughout the academic year. This data could reveal important trends about nutrition, convenience, and lifestyle choices among students. Additionally, it may highlight the role of campus dining services and their popularity or challenges. Understanding these habits can be very useful for university administrations when planning services and resources. Moreover, it can guide students in making informed choices about their eating habits during their studies. Overall, this research could contribute to discussions on student well-being and health.

The goal of this project should be to make the art of theater more accessible. I would like to invent a service that provides access to translations, as well as sign language and audio descriptions. Furthermore, this website/campaign should include trigger warnings and an insight into the backstage of a performance if necessary. The features shall include everybody and take the magic of this form of art to another level. However, it is also important to conduct regular surveys to keep improving the service and get community feedback.

I would use Python to program an interactive language learning program. With a focus on vocabulary and grammar for the language you are learning. With different levels and difficulties, as well as a rewarding system, it would motivate people to learn new languages and have fun learning.

The goal of this project is to teach students the fundamentals of web scraping using Python. First, they will install the necessary libraries, `requests` and `BeautifulSoup`. Next, students will select a publicly accessible website from which to scrape data. They will learn to send an HTTP GET request to retrieve the HTML content. Using `BeautifulSoup`, they will parse the HTML to extract relevant information based on specific tags. The extracted data can then be saved into a CSV file or a database for later analysis. Finally, students will analyze the gathered data to draw meaningful insights. This project combines practical programming skills with real-world data handling.

The project proposes the development of a mobile app aimed at enhancing consumer awareness about product sustainability. Users can scan barcodes or QR codes to receive instant insights into the environmental and ethical practices of products. The app will feature user reviews and community feedback, fostering a transparent environment for informed decision-making. Additionally, there could be a rewards system for sustainable purchases, offering discounts or loyalty points. Partnerships with local sustainable businesses can provide users with access to eco-friendly alternatives. Real-time updates on sustainability practices and trends will keep users engaged and informed. Education features, such as articles and tips on sustainable living, could further enhance user experience. Overall, this app aims to empower consumers to make more environmentally conscious choices while supporting sustainable brands.

I’d like to code an integrated project management tool with to-do list, budget planning and with an elaborated calendar function, that also lets you divide academic to-dos from private activities and events. It’s meant for students to organize their private and uni life including an eye being kept at expenses since it can be tricky to start studying and moving to a new town while trying to be social and keep up with uni at the same time. Also, budgeting apps are often missing a real calendar function so maybe combining both of these functions can help especially with starting in a new town.
Scissor paper rock

1. You could program something that makes it possible to scan food and products in the supermarket and find out about their carbon footprint. This would make it easy to find out the water consumption of a fruit or its country of origin and the corresponding travel time. In the case of meat, it would also be easy to find out about the farming methods used and the associated CO2 emissions, enabling consumers to consciously choose more sustainable products. This would enable people to shop more consciously and sustainably, with minimal effort.

I already had an idea for a small coding project. I thought of a program which generates daily recipes for when you don’t know what to eat on a specific day. I prompted it to this AI tool and it kind of specified the idea a little more. It generated the idea which I liked the most, that you put your ingredients available to you into this program and it comes up with a recipe for you to cook. I don’t know yet if this is something which is hard to do, but I like the idea so far.

The project should help students manage their time more efficiently and timely. So they can submit their assessments in due time and keep their stress for learning for exams as low as possible. It should be uncomplicated, free and bring a little motivation to finish the assignments as early as possible. It will be structured like a calendar and to-do list with due dates. And rewards.

My idea is to create an intelligent, interactive calculator that does more than just compute results. It would analyze the problem based on the given question and numbers, then identify relevant mathematical rules or formulas using key facts. Instead of simply providing an answer, the calculator would explain the reasoning and general approach behind the solution. This way, students can better understand why certain steps are taken rather than just following them. The tool could adapt to different types of problems, from basic arithmetic to more complex applications. It would serve as both a calculator and a learning assistant. The goal is to make problem-solving more intuitive and educational, helping students build long-term understanding of mathematical concepts.
Brainstorming ideas: annoyance picking colours while coding: colour converter to different forms: hex codes etc. quick emoticons for user input words.

I‘m planning to do a website, where people from all over the world can talk to each other about different problems, no matter what language they‘re speaking. It should also be possible to stay anonymous. First you can choose a topic, why you want to reach out, for example you are feeling lonely. Based on your topic you will get into a chatroom or videocall with another person that chose the same topic. The website will also translate everything into your native language, so that you don‘t have to worry about misunderstanding.

I use a vocabulary app on my smartphone (Vokabeltrainer, by Ruben Gees) that allows one to write one's own vocabulary entries. The app provides the ability to download all the written vocabulary entries in the form of one lengthy text document, but this is not in a legible format, inserting various elements of programming language into the text and not neatly separating each vocabulary entry. I would be curious if I could write a code that understands Vokabeltrainer's writing conventions and can transform its text file into a proper dictionary format that could ideally distinguish between the different languages that one may have learnt.

My idea is a program called EcoPal, where the users' own sustainability can be enhanced through gamification. The main goal is to create environmental mindfulness through habit tracking. Daily or weekly challenges like "avoid plastic bottles today" combined with visual progress could motivate users. In this program, "EcoPoints" could be used to compete with your friends or customize your program layout. Optional features would be progress charts, for example. Ecohabit could have a long-lasting effect on users, because it motivates.

The idea of the project is to create a news summarizer that promotes critical thinking skills and news accessibility by giving different news sources and summaries on the same topic.

To create this bias-free news summarizer, the project would begin by gathering a diverse array of news articles from various reputable sources covering the same events. This would involve developing web-scraping tools or utilizing APIs from news aggregators to ensure a comprehensive collection. Each article would then be analyzed for key themes, facts, and opinions using natural language processing (NLP) techniques to maintain neutrality.

The next step would be to design an algorithm that identifies and compares the viewpoints presented in the different articles, labeling any potential biases. Summarization techniques, such as extractive and abstractive summarization, would be employed to compile an unbiased overview of the story from multiple perspectives. The user interface would need to clearly present the sources and the summarized information, allowing users to access the original articles for further reading. Finally, rigorous testing and user feedback would be essential to refine the tool and ensure its effectiveness in promoting unbiased news consumption.

- an app that functions as an everyday helper
- includes to-do list, weather app, shopping list, calendar, etc.
- can be personalized (different designs, customized dashboard (kinda like the myStudy Dashboard))
- some games to play when bored

The time display of a washing machine is very unreliable. Sometimes the machine takes longer than originally anticipated. I want to change the frustration of waiting in front of the washing machine to finish by creating an IoT device, which uses the vibration of the machine as an indicator to when it finishes and sends a push notification to your phone. I‘m going to use Micropython on ESP32 to realize this project.

A To-Do List for grocery storage. You can add the groceries you have and the date when they go bad. The program should show what should be used first in red and what’s good for longer should be green.
A tool that helps you to understand what you are feeling and gives examples on what you can do to better your mood.

When you don’t know what to cook with the ingredients you still have, you can select or type what you have. Then your dietary restrictions, like vegan, or dairy or gluten free, then if you want also what style, like Italian or Asian you want your meal to be. And how much time you have. And then it searches for matching recipes.
An app that makes it possible to reduce food waste. You can scan the items you have at home to create a meal, or it gives you a smart shopping list with a few things you would still need to buy.

A Unit Name converter for One Page Rules. You type in the name of a 40K unit and it gives you the OPR equivalent. This makes it easier to convert 40K army lists to OPR since you don't have to google what the equivalents are.
I'm creating a program that randomly gives you a recipe for different situations.

My idea is to design a kind of digital cheating system for the game Stadt, Land, Fluss. I want to create a database with especially unlikely words for others to choose or with answers I find really funny or endearing. In the end, I want this database to have for every letter of the alphabet in combination with all the categories that are classically available, several fitting answers which the program spews out. It decides between several fitting answers randomly.
I want to code a countdown calendar software that allows users to perceive time more effectively. This would allow users to prioritize more consciously.
